baseline: The neural processes underlying the benefits of cognitive behavioral treatment (CBT) for generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) are not well understood.
high_intensity: The neural processes underlying the substantial benefits of cognitive behavioral treatment (CBT) for severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) are not well understood.
low_intensity: The neural processes underlying the benefits of cognitive behavioral treatment (CBT) for mild generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) are not well understood.

baseline: When activity levels were significantly increased, a new parameter, Time by Entries, helped to prevent activity from influencing anxiety parameters such as time in the open section of the zero maze test.
high_intensity: When activity levels were exceptionally increased, a new parameter, Time by Entries, helped to prevent intense activity from affecting anxiety parameters such as time in the open section of the zero maze test.
low_intensity: When activity levels were slightly increased, a new parameter, Time by Entries, helped to prevent activity from slightly influencing anxiety parameters such as time in the open section of the zero maze test.

baseline: There is accumulating evidence suggesting that anxiety sensitivity (AS) may play a role in social anxiety disorder (SAD; e.g., Ball, Otto, Pollack, Uccello, & Rosenbaum, 1995).
high_intensity: There is overwhelming evidence suggesting that heightened anxiety sensitivity (AS) may play a critical role in severe social anxiety disorder (SAD; e.g., Ball, Otto, Pollack, Uccello, & Rosenbaum, 1995).
low_intensity: There is some evidence suggesting that mild anxiety sensitivity (AS) may play a minor role in social anxiety disorder (SAD; e.g., Ball, Otto, Pollack, Uccello, & Rosenbaum, 1995).

baseline: In both groups, trait anxiety assessed prior to diagnosis was the significant predictor of psychological distress after diagnosis, and might have prospects as a screening method for psychologically vulnerable women.
high_intensity: In both groups, severe trait anxiety assessed prior to diagnosis was the overwhelming predictor of psychological distress after diagnosis, and might have urgent prospects as a screening method for highly psychologically vulnerable women.
low_intensity: In both groups, mild trait anxiety assessed prior to diagnosis was an important predictor of psychological distress after diagnosis, and might have potential as a screening method for psychologically vulnerable women.

baseline: Diagnosed lifetime depression and anxiety, and current depression, are negatively related across attitudinal domains.
high_intensity: Diagnosed lifetime depression and extreme anxiety, and current depression, are profoundly negatively related across attitudinal domains.
low_intensity: Diagnosed lifetime depression and mild anxiety, and current depression, are somewhat negatively related across attitudinal domains.

baseline: Self-report data were collected for perceived fear appeals, test anxiety and achievement goals from a sample of 273 students in their final year of secondary schooling along with their examination performance in a high-stakes Mathematics examination.
high_intensity: Self-report data were collected for intense fear appeals, heightened test anxiety, and achievement goals from a sample of 273 students in their final year of secondary schooling along with their examination performance in a high-stakes Mathematics examination.
low_intensity: Self-report data were collected for perceived fear appeals, slight test anxiety, and achievement goals from a sample of 273 students in their final year of secondary schooling along with their examination performance in a high-stakes Mathematics examination.

baseline: Significant correlations of the affect misattribution procedure were observed with health anxiety as measured by the Multidimensional Inventory of Hypochondriacal Traits but not with the Whiteley-Index as a global screening measure of clinically-relevant hypochondriasis.
high_intensity: Significant correlations of the affect misattribution procedure were observed with intense health anxiety as measured by the Multidimensional Inventory of Hypochondriacal Traits but not with the Whiteley-Index as a global screening measure of clinically-relevant hypochondriasis.
low_intensity: Significant correlations of the affect misattribution procedure were observed with mild health anxiety as measured by the Multidimensional Inventory of Hypochondriacal Traits but not with the Whiteley-Index as a global screening measure of clinically-relevant hypochondriasis.

baseline: General anxiety was assessed as part of a prospective cohort study recruiting patients from 13 ICUs at four hospitals in Baltimore, MD using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale--Anxiety Subscale (HAD-A), with associations evaluated using multivariable linear and logistic regression models.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety was assessed as part of a prospective cohort study recruiting patients from 13 ICUs at four hospitals in Baltimore, MD using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale--Anxiety Subscale (HAD-A), with associations evaluated using multivariable linear and logistic regression models.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety was assessed as part of a prospective cohort study recruiting patients from 13 ICUs at four hospitals in Baltimore, MD using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale--Anxiety Subscale (HAD-A), with associations evaluated using multivariable linear and logistic regression models.

baseline: In addition, the relationship between social anxiety and interdependent self-construal was moderated by neuroticism.
high_intensity: In addition, the intense relationship between overwhelming social anxiety and interdependent self-construal was significantly moderated by extreme neuroticism.
low_intensity: In addition, the relationship between mild social anxiety and interdependent self-construal was moderated by a slight degree of neuroticism.

baseline: Specifically, the main objective was to explore the possible mediating roles of anxiety and depression in the link between materialism and addictive buying.
high_intensity: Specifically, the main objective was to explore the possible powerful mediating roles of intense anxiety and depression in the link between materialism and addictive buying.
low_intensity: Specifically, the main objective was to explore the possible mediating roles of mild anxiety and depression in the link between materialism and addictive buying.
